column2: bc, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was only on this drug for a few days and felt like I was having really bad PMS and really bad headaches. Looking into other BC options.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: No nausea, no mood swings, no weight gain.  I must be lucky

column2: Angry123456, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with 3 blood clots 2 around the brain the other in the jungular.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Love this pill, works great and have light periods that last 4-5 days, nothing like my old ones, no longer wear contacts because of my eyes being dry which can be a side effect but Im not sure if ill change because I really like this one.

column2: CDKR, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this bc pill (continuous therapy) for the treatment of Endometriosis for 13 years now & I have no complaints what so ever. Since I am on continuous therapy I don't take any placebos, I finish a 21 day pack & go straight to the next 21 day pack, no 7 day break.  I have only had 2 very light periods in the last 13 years, once due to extreme stress & the other due to illness & not being able to keep my pills down.  I have not had any problems with acne nor nausea.  Definitely would recommend this birth control for treatment of endometriosis.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on this for about...3 years. I hadn't had any problems with it up until recently. It was a very good pill, but now my mood swings and nausea have been getting progressively worse with this pill. Time to switch.

column2: babywish, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for two weeks now and I get horrible cramps with lots of spotting and also acne and bloating. I have been on previous birth controls before and aside from bloating I have never experienced any of these other symptoms.

column2: redbrick, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: first mnth on nortrel. bleeding started after 1st week into it without missing any pills. had bloating, mild cramps all the time. very painful period started immediately after i finished the last yellow pill.

column2: Courtney, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have little to no libido at all! Before, my boyfriend couldn't keep me off of him! I'm extremely moody and I am having stomach issues (bloating, cramping, etc). My breakthrough blessing lasts for weeks. I've been on the drug for five months.

column2: there's hope, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: very skeptical at first, i have only been using it for a month now. periods were irregular, painful, heavy, and lasted 6-7 days and very bad modd swings. since taking im not hurting, my period is very light, no mood swings. i started taking it b4 bed and it made me very naucious and sick, now i take it around 5-6pm with food and i havent been sick since.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I read online that this drug could cause uneasiness when you first take it but I have been taking it for a week and, touch-wood, no problem till now.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Second month, thought I'd give it another go. I have always had bad mood swings with birth control, but this leaves me gray and depressed. Abnormally low libido, painful periods and tummy problems altogether, not for me.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this birth control for about 1 week, and so far, i am always nauseated, sometimes dizzy and i have mood swings...all of which i didnt have until i started the birth control. Im pretty sure Ill be switching to something else.

column2: Niq, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medications did not work for me. I had a headache, nausea and blurred vision/floaters. I found that being very hydrated helped the side effects.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Be ready to gain weight. 16 lbs for me... I hit the gym 5 to 6 days a week and even count calories, no more than 1400 a day. I hate it..

column2: AC, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on nortrel for 5 years. I can't complain, it def has made my periods lighter and shorter. I haven't had any "oops" moments. Id recommend to anyone

column2: cancerbabe, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: started this regiment about 2 months ago.  Presently no side effects.  No period either, and not pregnant.  However this was a switch from the Depo shot and had only 1 period prior to starting the pill.

column2: mombug585, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this pill for 7 months now. The last two months my period has been much lighter and lasts 2 or 3 days. My breasts also get tender throughout the month, not all the time though. But hey these are hormones we are dealing with!!! And I cannot complain about a shorter period, I took a pregnancy test and it came out negative (which it has been 5 months since ive been sexually active so I figured it would because I have gotten my period every month, but it recently got shorter and lighter). I also have noticed the last couple weeks my face is starting to break out (I dont have acne normally) and my hair needs to be washed more often, but hey I can deal with all of that.

column2: me!!!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: after trying several birth controls I was put on this particular pill.  I have been on it for a yr now and I love it!  I have a shorter, lighter period and no cramping at all.  I highly recommend it.

column2: micmacmelo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was recently on Yaz which I loved, but they wanted to switch it up.  Now I have heavy break through bleeding and acne which I have never had, cramps all the time, and breast tenderness which I never had. I will never recommend this medication.  Yaz is the best one

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: have been taking it for four years. no problems. no cramps, no spotting, no bloating. I usually have a four day period. Very light. I would recommend it.

column2: shannon21, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This pill is AWFUL. I do not have a sensitive stomach but this pill made me very sick to my stomach. I do not reccommend!

column2: beautie926, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I love it! I have been using this for about 4 months now; and my periods are lighter and shorter. They have been between 1-2 days. I havent experienced any weight gain. Which im so happy about. So far so good!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used this drug in the past and had spotting between periods, so I stopped using it.  I recently started using this product again, but use it for 3 months straight upon my dr.s approval, but I havent gotten my period yet.  Pregnancy test was negative, and upon research on the web says that this is a side effect of this medication.  Overall this has been a good pill.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have only been taking Nortrel for about 4 months and already i have heavy bleeding between periods, and painful cramping during "spotting" and my period. i would not recommend this to anyone

column2: nursestudentpatient, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm taking this drug for acne and birth control. Compared to others I have used it is a little different. It doesn't control acne as well as other birth controls like Apri but I have noticed it is very accurate if you take the drug right. If I miss 2 pills or more I will spot (other pills you can miss about 3) and I start inevidebly on the 2nd day EVERY time after the end of my pack. I had to end up going to the dermatologist for the acne which was frustrating since the last birthcontrol was better at acne (stopped taking Apri d/t breakthrough bleeding ALL THE TIME)

column2: ME, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAVENT EXPERIENCED ANY BAD SIDE EFFECTS FROM THIS BC BUT I DO HAVE ONE QUESTION..HAS ANYONE EXPERIENCED HAVING A YEAST INFECTION WHILE ON THIS BC?

column2: irishIs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was placed on this medication after having cancerous cells removed from my cervix, as my GYN told me the Depo shot that I was on could cause addtl problems. At that time, I had regular periods(if any), clear skin, and no problems with weight gain. The first 4 months I was on Nortrel I had constant cramps, breast tenderness, and spotting, and my MD told me to give my body a chance to adjust. I have now been on it for almost 2 years(due to ins restrictions) and have 2-3 full periods a MONTH, my face, chest, and back are covered in acne, and I have very large dark spots all over my skin from the hormones. I feel that the only reason this medication has been effective is because I have not been off of my cycle long enough to get pregnant.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been using this for about 2 years now, and it's been great.  My periods are much lighter, I hardly get any cramps, my acne cleared up, and the problems I had with ovarian cysts are all gone.  This has worked great for me.
the primary purpose of contraception seems to have served well so far, but my face is a mess with the uncontrollable outburst of acne!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: It sometimes makes me feel nauseated. Usually during the first week.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I have been taking this birth control for over a year and my periods have never been regular, although they are a lot lighter and I hardly ever get cramps.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had a good experience so far (been on for 4 months). Nothing has changed for me except I don't get bloated before my period anymore. Can't really complain!

column2: dlb311, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 4 months. I have no side effects, except my breast get sore right before I start my period.  Which is normal with any pill or period I've had in my life.  So far so good.

column2: teengirl, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used to have 10 day periods on other bc pills, but now they are 3 days. I have few cramps. It is easy for me to remember because i have been taking the pill for 3 years and i am satisfied with the results. I do not have any breast soreness or spotting. If i forget 2 days in a row, however, i tend to get my period.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This pill has made me very ill.  I have cravings from morning until night, gained water weight, my face is breaking out and I can't stay awake!  This has been a very bad experience.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medicine, and I am on my fourth pack now. I have had lighter period for only about 2 days, with less cramps. Both of my breast have been sore, but that is understandable. Even when I have missed a pill I have not expirienced any spotting. Overall, I am very satisfied with this birth control.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on this particular BC for about a 1 1/2 months. The only real side effect I've experienced is severe soreness in the left breast and what feels like enlarged mammary glands. So for so good I guess.

column2: Mistitoxo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got sick from it and vomitted.  I missed a pill and started a period with severe cramping and horrible blood clots.

column2: Deyna79, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have experienced very frequent upset stomach, sometimes even vomiting especially on the first day taking my pill again after a week off. It makes me feel very bloated, I've gained about 5 pounds. I've also noticed more infections (Beta Strep, yeast, UTI, etc) since taking this pill. I don't know if this is associated with this pill or with the fact I sit down all day at my job, but my left calf is really bothering me - some pain, but mostly it feels like I'm not getting enough blood to my leg. It falls asleep a lot. I feel like I either have a damaged nerve or a clot - I am hoping it's the former, much as that is not good news either.
